intro: Secamone saligna, commonly known as the silky secamone, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are arranged in clusters. Secamone saligna is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
